byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Andrew Higgins from Brussels. Michael R. Gordon and Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Washington, and Ian Austen from Ottawa.
byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ANDREW HIGGINS

abstract: Pres Obama, appearing at joint news conference with Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, signals that he will await outcome of peace talks before deciding whether to provide lethal weapons to Ukraine in struggle against Russian aggression; choice would represent significant break with European allies who oppose providing arms.
lead_paragraph: Appearing with Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, President Obama expressed hope for a diplomatic solution in Ukraine but said the United States would consider sending weapons if talks failed.

headline.main: Obama Awaits Outcome of Ukraine Peace Talks Before Deciding on Arms
headline.print_headline: Obama Awaits Outcome of Ukraine Peace Talks Before Deciding on Arms

snippet: Appearing with Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, President Obama expressed hope for a diplomatic solution in Ukraine but said the United States would consider sending weapons if talks failed.
